text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Usui was born in Tokyo Metropolis on December 28, 1989. After graduating from Waseda University, she retired from playing career. However, after 1 year blank, she restarted playing career at Sfida Setagaya FC in 2013.Sfida Setagaya FC She moved to Urawa Reds in 2014.Urawa Reds She played 44 matches in 3 seasons. In 2017, she moved to Nojima Stella Kanagawa Sagamihara.Nojima Stella Kanagawa Sagamihara She retired end of 2018 season.Nojima Stella Kanagawa Sagamihara On September 13, 2014, Usui debuted for the Japan national team against Ghana. She played for Japan at 2014 Asian Games and Japan won the 2nd place. She played 6 games for Japan in 2014. ==Statistics== List of match in 2014 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2014 6 0 Total 6 0 ==References== Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Tokyo Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Urawa Red Diamonds Ladies players Category:Nojima Stella Kanagawa Sagamihara players Category:Footballers at the 2014 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 2014 Asian Games
title: Rie Usui
